eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu.social

Class TabardMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.wauz.wauzcore.menu.social.TabardMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WauzInventory

    public class TabardMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements WauzInventory
    An inventory that can be used as menu or for other custom interaction mechanics. This inventory lets a player choose their equipped tabard / banner.
    Author:
    Wauzmons
    See Also:
    TabardBuilder

      Creates a banner item stack for the given tabard name, that is either based on a preset, a custom guild tabard, or a barrier menu item, able to unequip the current tabard.

      • open

        public static void open(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Opens the menu for the given player. Shows a list of all selectable tabards / banners.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that should view the inventory.
        See Also:
        getTabardByName(Player, String), MenuUtils.setBorders(Inventory)

      • selectMenuPoint

        public void selectMenuPoint(org.bukkit.event.inventory.InventoryClickEvent event)
        Checks if an event in this inventory was triggered by a player click. Cancels the event and equips the tabard / banner, if a valid one was clicked.
        Specified by:
        selectMenuPoint in interface WauzInventory
        Parameters:
        event - The inventory click event.
        See Also:
        PlayerConfigurator.setCharacterTabard(Player, String), equipSelectedTabard(Player)

      • equipSelectedTabard

        public static void equipSelectedTabard(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
        Lets the player equip the tabard that has been set in their config. If it is null or a barrier, air will be equipped in the tabard slot.
        Parameters:
        player - The player that should equip the tabard.
        See Also:
        PlayerConfigurator.getCharacterTabard(Player), getTabardByName(Player, String)

      • getTabardByName

        private static org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getTabardByName(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                                              java.lang.String tabardName)
        Creates a banner item stack for the given tabard name, that is either based on a preset, a custom guild tabard, or a barrier menu item, able to unequip the current tabard.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who requested the tabard.
        tabardName - The name of the requested tabard.
        Returns:
        The requested tabard.
